refnamediv.refpurpose: returns the unique file name within temporary directory of the operating system

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The following function is used to obtain unique name of a file, which is located in temporary directory on file system. The two optional parameters can be supplied: prefix of the file and extension for it. These will be prepended and appended (dot MUST be omitted) to the unique string. The directory where this file is located depends of $TMPDIR or %TMP% environment settings for UNIX's and Windows platforms respectively. If these environment settings are not available or empty, the defaults will be used for the operation system. (in practice for most UNIX's it's /tmp or /var/tmp directory). Note that this function do NOT open the file, it only give us a name.

refsect2.title: prefix
refsect2.para: prefix to the file name to be added. MUST be at most five characters.

refsect2.title: suffix
refsect2.para: extension to the file to be added, the leading dot MUST be omitted.

example.title: Getting a unique file name
example.programlisting:
SQL> select tmp_file_name('FOO', 'EXT'); callret VARCHAR ________________________________________
/tmp/FOOFoCnq5.EXT
1 Rows. -- 7 msec.
